Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Koreatown”
Reviews.Author: JillieBean77
Reviews.Content: I was visiting my sister in Los Angeles, and this hotel was just down the street from where she lives. The rooms were big, clean, and neat. The front desk staff were polite and helpful. I had no problem with the free parking. In fact, I got to LA so early that they let me park my car and leave it there all day before I checked in. I was really worried about my brand new car in the big city, but the neighborhood was really safe and they have employees who are constantly walking through the parking area. Slept like a baby. Will definitely be staying here again the next time I'm in town.

Reviews.Title: “LA Stay”
Reviews.Author: msimon75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our trip to LA for girls weekend. Nice, clean hotel. Quiet area. Parking an issue, as well as only 4 television stations. One block from Metro rail station, had a CVS store a block away as well. Found a wonderful restaraunt across the street and 1 1/2 blocks down. Also very close to the Wiltern Theatre. Overall a good stay with nice staff for a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable.”
Reviews.Author: oneeddy1
Reviews.Content: Older time genre of layout of room. Guess i got used to lcd tv's. Size of room good. Towels thick. Free parking. Easy access to parking garage. Upon check in, be careful when backing out into the street in the 10 min guest registration. They do charge you a refundable $50 fee for incidentals. Witch is credited back on check out. 5 min walk to purple line metro.. Close to wiltern theater. Pizza hut open late. Dennys and ralphs grocery nearby. Fridge in room. Check out at noon. Didnt have any issues w staff. Saw security patrolling the parking structure. free Wifi. Didn't eat breakfast or go to the restaurant. I felt great value for the l a area. Much more reasonable than downtown hotels and not paying the $25 plus for Parking. Korea town is not bevelry hills, but around the western/Wilshire area, felt safe walking at night. would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “LOUSY RUNDOWN OVERPRICED”
Reviews.Author: Josiedes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lousy, rundown, and had awful customer service. The room was shabby at best, and lacked a security guard. Worst stay ever.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodTravelCub
Reviews.Content: Location excellent, off the subway Purpleline. Rooms are OK. Bathrooms are spacious. No roomservice. Staff was fair, could you customer service training.

Reviews.Title: “Really Needs Some work"”
Reviews.Author: mab313
Reviews.Content: sorry Ramada, but I can't really reccommend your place here in LA, central Wilshire area. Just a little too shabby in most areas. It has a faded look, and really needs a make-over. I have a feeling it was built in the 70's, the way it is laid out and split-up into 2 different "towers". The worst thing for me is the lack of maintainence. The elevetor in the garage tower-pretty bad. The bathrooms-old and not very clean. The TV was from the mid-90's I bet. The beds seemed ok. Not nearly enough outlets in the room for re-charging stuff. Did have free internet. Fairly quiet. Free breakfast was coffee, orange juice and a box of doughnuts! Well, the doughnuts were pretty good, fresh, but not the healthiest of meals. The garage was strange-one level only, and you had to back out onto a ramp that goes right onto the street. The neighborhood seemed safe and active. There were a couple of really good places to eat across the street. Too bad there isn't more competition in this area of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for an event at the Wiltern but thats it.”
Reviews.Author: wonderinglilOne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights as we were attending a concert at the wiltern theater. The hotel is in a central location in Korea town but that’s about it. The rooms are dated, bathroom pretty dingy and the staff was extremely rude. When we tried to check in one hour before check-in we were told absolutely not. This wouldn’t have been that big an issue but I’m pregnant and after the long drive really needed to use a restroom. When I asked if there was one in the hotel I could use I was told no, that only the mens restroom was operable. Ok fine, I then asked about the free parking as advertised on their website so we could walk to a near by establishment and wait out our hour before check-in and I was told that parking was $10. I told the lady that the website said free parking and she told me I must have been looking at the wrong website! VERY SHADY trying to rip us off. Like I said the only good thing I can say is that the location was good for our purpose and the pillows were soft.

Reviews.Title: “Safe Neighborhood, Clean, Friendly, Good Deal for the Price.”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodTravelerWho
Reviews.Content: Security guard on premises, gated parking (10.00) there is some free parking. The room was clean, we had two double beds. The allow for 4 people with no up charge. Patrick and Min were friendly at the front desk, no questions asked for the extra towels, etc. Someone was at the desk 24hrs. Three miles from Sunset Blvd; it was very quiet in and around the hotel. It was perfect for what we needed. Don't expect a 5 star hotel.... expect a clean bed and friendly staff. For the money it was perfect. There is an ice, snack and drink machine available, refrigerator in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Goldz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 6 nights. Our room was very clean, reasonably spacious, and had adequate storage space and heating and cooling. The small refrigerator in it was very useful. The daily maid service was excellent. Our room lacked a clock and a radio. Although this hotel is on Wilshire Boulevard, we found it quiet at night. The location is extremely handy. Not only are there a Ralphs supermarket and coin laundry nearby, as well as numerous Korean BBQ grills, Wilshire Blvd is on an extensive bus network, which will take you downtown, to LACMA, and to Santa Monica. This hotel is a top choice for the budget traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: mexicanote
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in Koreatown, near downtown LA and relatively near attractions like Hollywood, etc. Though there's no free parking, they charge only $10 to park for the whole stay. There's free WiFi but it is a little flaky as it can often be in hotels. Our room was nothing spectacular but well appointed and clean (see photos). Location-wise the hotel is barely a block or two away from restaurants and shops like Sizzler, Denny's, Pollo Loco, Starbucks, CVS Pharmacy, Ralph's supermarkets, etc. Considering how expensive hotels in LA can be, this hotel represents good value when staying in LA on a mid budget.

Reviews.Title: “" Front desk was terrible"”
Reviews.Author: soccerchild
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was ok, the front desk had no clue about anything in the area. I could not get the young clerk to stop talking on the phone with friends. She was laughing and having a great old time, and couldnt answer one question i had regarding places to eat in the area. Was very rude and i will never stay here again. Also refused to give me a reciept becasue i didnt book through them.

Reviews.Title: “Decent place downtown”
Reviews.Author: flyermontana
Reviews.Content: I was pretty nervous about staying alone in a motel downtown, but this worked out pretty well. I particularly liked the very safe, protected parking area ($10 charge for the whole stay) right next to the elevator. The room was clean and comfortable and in pretty good shape, but there's only a fridge, no microwave. The area is heavily Asian, and feels pretty safe--there are Asian restaurants everywhere (including a very classy looking one attached to the hotel itself), and kind of a family feel to the area despite being downtown. Very nice lobby area, but no business center (although a sign by the desk says there IS a business center) and no fitness facility even though one was advertised. The Internet signal was not strong, but it was adequate if you didn't need to watch videos. I got an amazing rate on Priceline and would stay here again for that rate when I need to be downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, but average for a cheap LA hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When you look for a cheap, central LA hotel, this is what you get. Broken elevator, old dingy rooms, incompetent front desk...but cheapish price and good location between downtown and Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “The service, location and price made up for any tiny fault”
Reviews.Author: MStatic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for a week, I just needed a medium cheap good safe place in LA. So i booked it online and in mistake took a day extra so i called the hotel and even if the booking said i can't cancel for the cheaper price the nice lady let me cancel one of my nights. From lax i just took a flyaway bus to union station and a metro ride to Wilshire, found easily to the hotel and checked in to a comfy room with a kingsized bed. felt like luxury for a solo traveler. The room had a fridge and a coffee maker, every morning the cleaning ladies gave me new towels and new coffee. I loved the easiness of living there. The room was a bit old decor, but i just felt nostalgic. I did have to pay a deposit of 70 dollars, but they just charged me 50 usd and i got my cash back at the end of the stay. They even booked me a taxi when i asked for it. The only thing was that the walls where a bit thin when my next door neighbor decided to look at tv and sing her soul out. But i blame the guest more then the hotel, i was just cranky cos i had jetlagged. The internet stopped working at the end of my stay, but the check up lady said she could print anything i needed. The hotels new restaurant Harang was wonderful. The service was good and the food was delicious. I recommend you to try the korean dishes. For a young traveller like me, this was paradise. Feel free to ask me anything.

Reviews.Title: “Old and smelly, needs to be remodeled”
Reviews.Author: kbl437
Reviews.Content: The place really needs to be remodeled. The lobby was okay, but once you go up to the rooms the halls are dim and the carpet is pretty worn out. The rooms had a funny smell, like old people. On our last night, I stopped by CVS and bought a travel size Febreze to freshen up the room. The bathroom sink looked dirty because it was scratched up. The drainage hole in the sink basin that prevents water from overflowing was clogged so it had a mildewy, rotten smell from the stagnant water. Our shower was missing a towel bar so there was two big holes in the shower wall. Some of the windows had no window screen so if you plan to go during bug season don't open the windows. The hotel states on their website that there is free high speed wireless internet in every room but when we tried to logon it was absolutely pointless. We stayed on the 4th floor and the signal was so weak we couldn't even get to logon page. It kept saying connecting, but it never did. We just gave up and settled for our IPhones' 3G network, but was disappointed for the wasted space in our carry on luggage. One morning, we walked down to the lobby and there were 5-6 people on their laptops. I'm guessing you have to be in the vicinity of the lobby to get their free wifi? Location was quiet and there were many restaurants located within walking distance. If you do stay here or around K-Town, walk on over to Kalbi Burger. The burgers are juicy and delicious. The hotel restaurant boasts that they serve breakfast, lunch, and dinner daily however it was not open for breakfast (we dropped by on Tuesday @ 8am). If I plan to travel to L.A. again I would never go back there. I picked this place because it was close by to the wedding I was attending and the inn had free parking. Our friends stayed here too and they weren't impressed either, but for a place where you need a good nights rest it was okay overall since we were barely in our rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, not bad”
Reviews.Author: SactoGamer
Reviews.Content: My coworker and I checked into the Ramada Inn on Wilshire in LA for three nights while we attended the E3 Expo at the LA Convention Center. For the price, the room really wasn't that bad but it's one of those things that if the room cost much more than it did (an average of $85 per night) I wouldn't be giving it as good of grades as I have. Like many Los Angeles hotels, this Ramada isn't in the best of neighborhoods but we didn't feel like we were going to get mugged while outside at night. The restaurant inside of the hotel was closed due to health concerns, which is a red flag but there are plenty of food options within a very easy walk from the hotel. The nicest thing about its location is that it's only a block or so from a Metro subway stop which made it extremely easy to get to the convenvtion center. The room wasn't the best we've been in quality-wise but at least it was clean. The beds were comfy but the floor was lumpy, which was odd. All of the electronics worked fine as did the free WiFi. The bathroom was also clean and well-stocked. There was one thing that stuck out, though: The flush handle on the toiled liked to pop-off. It was easy to re-install each time, but the hotel's maintenance guys should think about putting a dab of glue on the mount to prevent this from happening. The Ramada Inn at Wilshire Center isn't a bad hotel at all (for the price). So long as it doesn't get any more expensive that $80-something per night, it's a good option. If it gets more expensive, look elsewhere because you can do better for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place; good price.”
Reviews.Author: bobasarang
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a few friends for a concert. We were there 4 nights; and overall, it was a great experience staying in there. Staff were really nice, especially when my friend wanted to heat up her food; we went down to the lobby and ask if we could heat up the food. They kindly let us. -- Service was nice, though we had our sign up saying don't disturb lol (we'd call to ask for extra towels or toilet paper. -- Another upside? Mr. Pizza Factory is right next to the hotel, you guys should try this pizza place; it's so good. I'd stay at this hotel again; and it's a good price too

Reviews.Title: “ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?!”
Reviews.Author: anonymous60713
Reviews.Content: long story short... four people checked into the room. Hotel was clean but eerie. Dimmed Hallways, dim lights in the room. Our stay was going to be 4 days long. There was only two sets of towels in the room. We used one for our hands and the other for the floor since it would be slippery coming out of the shower. We call down to get more towels. We were told "No, you cannot have 5 more towels!!" We told him the situation and he sent up 3 towels. What was he thinking...that the four of us would share towels? Crazy customer service. We asked for 5 because sometimes we use the extra towel for our hair. We checked out that morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location---reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: EugeneDuck
Reviews.Content: Room nicely furnished, kept clean over a 5 day stay. Although hotel has a Wilshire address, the narrow end is on Wilshire and so most of rooms face a quieter side street. The big plus is the location--on a thoroughfare that has a lot of bus service. (LA has good bus service. Check info on their website. Distances are far so allow enough time to get there.) And only one block from the metro which is fast and goes to several tourist spots (again check their website). Denny's, Sizzler, a couple of blocks away. Several Korean restaurants also near. Ride from airport (via PrimeTime) was $24. I'll stay here again. Front desk helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I would come back.”
Reviews.Author: ecrstraveler
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I was concerned, but I would come back here again if I had business in the same area. Room was clean, staff friendly. Restaurant is closed, but lots of food in the neighborhood (grocery store a couple blocks away). I wouldn't walk around here at midnight, but that's true in many places. I felt very safe walking during day/evening.Front desk clerk was very helpful. I also got a very reasonable rate. Sound insulation is poor, so it was a little noisy when my upstairs neighbors woke up.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: Carley99_uk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and thought it was great value for money. We got a free upgrade on arrival which was an added bonus and the room was spacious and clean and the staff were really helpful and friendly - they went out of their way to help. The hotel is also very conveniently located, there is a subway not even a 5 minute walk away which can take you to most places you want to visit and there are lots of buses that pass regularly to take you to others. It is actually a prime location as you can get to all the tourist attractions on public transport much easier than a lot of other places. The area felt safe and there were restaurants and a supermarket near by. The only downside to this hotel from a backpacker point of view was that there was an addition $10 fee per day if you wanted a microwave which seemed quite expensive.However the reception staff offered the use of the one in their office for free.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at hotel three times and it stayed consistent”
Reviews.Author: lsgram
Reviews.Content: I've tried many hotels in the Los Angeles area. I find this one to be clean and decent for the money. I stayed there for conferences and liked the fact that it is quiet and peaceful to rest. I am not into the party scene and dont want to hear drunk guests storming down the hallway. I don't go to hotels to enjoy being in the building. I have my own vehicle so it is best to rent a car instead of paying cab fees. They don't charge for parking and internet service which is a bonus. Managers are nice and friendly. If you have a complaint just be polite and know everything no matter what hotel whether a $1 or $1000 a night it is not going to meet your every expectation. I know I worked in a casino whose villas are $10,000 a night. I will just say...be nice to the housekeepers.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE... UTTERLY DISGUSTING!!! ROACHES(Check the pic)”
Reviews.Author: LosAngelesScubasurf
Reviews.Content: MY GIRL WOKE UP TO FIND SHE CRUSHED A HUGE COCKROACH ON THE BED!!!! I have never written a review of anything online, but the Ramada Whishire is such a dump i felt compelled to warn future guests to stay away. I should have taking their own front desk employees advice and went elsewhere. When I asked him if it was a decent hotel he in all honesty said "No". Being that it was late and I had to be up in a few hours anyways I took my chances....BAD MOVE!!! There was not one redeeming quality about the room. The couch had a huge stain from god knows what and the overall appearance of the place felt dirty. And as previously metioned my girl woke up to find a dead ROACH underneath here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: cbqbill
Reviews.Content: This hotel seems to have been recently remodeled. My king single was clean with a very comfortable bed and refrigerator for a AAA rate of $79.00. The hotel is located one block from the Wilshire/Western station on the metro Purple Line from Union Station which is a $7 bus ride from LAX (Fly-Away). The restaurant has excellent American-style meals with room-service available.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevla88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my mother brother and a friend had 2 rooms with 2beds. was a pleasent stay nothing special has free internet! staff was nice and friendly. location of hotel was ok. about 3mins walk from the metro station. area is safe! over all short stay hotel =good if your staying for more then 2nights with a few people ask for a discount friendly staff :)

Reviews.Title: “My Mother Would Die If She Saw Where I Stayed.”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingMan1969
Reviews.Content: My boss makes me stay here for business. The place is gross. You can't even imagine. The staff does not have command of the English language. I have to draw pictures of things that I need because they just don't understand. If your fate is like mine and you have to stay here for some reason, do yourself a favor and don't go the restaurant. The food is overpriced and it’s creepy. Larry, Moe and Curly would be better waiters. The maids do their best for you…I’ll have to say that…but if you put whip cream on dog poop…it’s still dog poop. There is really not much they can do to make your stay bearable. After my long stay at the Ramada on Wilshire, I fly home, run into my house and head right for my bathroom to take a Silkwood shower before I kiss my wife and my daughter. It’s less than $70 a night for the room but it’s like buying a $3 steak. Why would you buy a $3 steak? It just doesn’t make sense.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RandomTravelerTx
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Ramada Inn for three nights and it was a very surprising pleasure. The hotel was small but the rooms were spacious. It was ideally located to see most of the LA and Hollywood sights. The room was very clean and furnished with a refrigerator and in room safe. The soaps and shampoos provided in Ramada are a cut above most hotels. The check in was hassle free and very quickly accomplished. The most attractive feature was the very convienient parking only a few steps from the elevator. The hotel was very quite and clean and the beds and pillows were high quality and provided for excellent sleep. The neighborhood was in Koreatown and had a very safe feeling. There were many restaurants drug stores and even a grocery store in easy walking distance. Many museums were a short drive away as was the Miracle Mile, Hollywood and Beverly Hills. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked It”
Reviews.Author: amk2f
Reviews.Content: OK, so for the price the hotel is offering, I think it's very good. This in case of course if you are only looking for a place to spend a night & plan on active travelling in LA or are on business trip. There's no pool in the hotel, no fitness center, no entertainment & the restaurant is rather questionable... Yet again it's not a resort anyway... The location is great - proximity to everything is a big advantage. Some people say the neighbourhood is scary & unsafe. Well, that is not true. Sure it's no Beverly Hills, but it's absolutely safe and not scary at all, though walking there during the night hours probably ain't a good idea. Another great advantage is two parkings, one of them underground, with lots of free space. I personally never had problems with finding a place to park my car, no matter when I returned to the hotel during the day or late at night. The price of the parking is great too - 10 dollars for the whole period of your stay. As for the room: it was clean, spacious & had everything one might need: a TV, an air conditioner, a hairdryer, a fridge, a telephone, an iron & a coffeemaker. To sum up I think the hotel is great for the young people, who plan to rent a car & go around LA either for business or for pleasure... Great location, convenient parking, comfortable rooms - that's quite a good deal in LA for that kind of a price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: rockyb42000
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried because I found this room cheap on ebay. The building itself is not very exciting from the outside, the parking is also kind of dread, however with the expectations low when we reached the room we were pleasantly surprised. The room was clean and ample, it appeared it had been renovated recently. Another good thing is the hotel location, close to many things including Hollywwod, Universal studios etc. One thing you need to be aware the hotel does not offer free breakfast (seems like they used to) some websites still offer the free breakfast and this creates some friction with the front desk, (I witnessed a woman asking for a letter stating the no breakfast situation so that she could take it to her travel agent and request a refund) Overall a good deal for the price paid

Reviews.Title: “Fine for one night”
Reviews.Author: oconnors
Reviews.Content: We booked the Ramada Wilshire Center at the last minute because due to our horrendous experience we had to leave the appalling Hotel Beverly Terrace in Beverly Hills almost immediately. The Ramada was an improvement on the Beverly Terrace. It is located in Korea-town, and it has good location in its favour. To console ourselves we upgraded to a suite. The best thing about it was the vast size of the room. It also had the customary iron, ironing board and fridge. I would speculate that this room may have been considered lavish thirty years ago. However, the décor is very tired and dated now and is in need of a complete renovation. I’m aware of the difference between ‘old’ and ‘dirty’. Our accommodation was not dirty; it was clean, just in need of renovation. Of course, this would be fine if one likes the ‘retro’ look. The bathroom was big and clean, but it too needs renovating as there were old cigarette burns on the counters around the sinks in this now non-smoking room. Although this room is now non-smoking, there was still a faint smell of smoke. Maybe some have been fortunate enough to have been given a newly redecorated room and if you book here it may be worth requesting one of these. We travel extensively and our main criteria for choosing a hotel is cleanliness and location, we’re not especially fussy or difficult to please. Room size is not too much of an issue because on average room sizes in Europe are small anyway. On our trip we stayed in nine different hotels and on our list this would come in at number 8 of 9. This hotel is fine for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't Impress Me Much”
Reviews.Author: JoyJoyJoyJoy
Reviews.Content: I dont know what these other guys are talking about. I just stayed at the Ramada on Wilshire and was very dissapointed. Parking cost me $10 a day! Not $5 which I think is crazy...I havn't stayed in many downtown hotels but I've never had to pay parking at a hotel. There wireless did not work the whole time and I was counting on it to do schoolwork which really sucked and when we asked for help with the internet the staff gave us the number of an outdated technical support center. When we told them this all they could say was sorry - but offered no help. There is no pool or hot tub but the rooms are very big. I found at least 10 ants crawling on the walls durring our stay. Worst of all there is no free breakfast. I think for the price it's a rip off. Go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: AndrewR2
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel for the price, very cheap parking in garage ($5). Clean rooms and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: yaletowngrls
Reviews.Content: I also got a great deal from ebay $30 a night and after reading reviews tried to switch to another hotel but in the end took it because of the location. I was pleasantly surprised. It was just my teen age daughter and my self and was very worried about safety and bugs. The room was clean and had a very large bathroom. No bugs either. We had two queen beds I believe and a small fridge which was great for drinks. I could not smell smoke in the halls. The staff was very friendly and helpful and free internet was great for my daughter and for printing off directions for the next day. Food was not much but I did not expect much for free breakfast. I did not venture out at night because of the reviews but after being out all day all I needed was a clean place to stay for the night. If you can get a good deal like me I would definately recommend as clean and location great for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Disgustingly dirty, modly, smelly, gross!”
Reviews.Author: shebeck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night before leaving on a cruise. I booked the stay through an Ebay seller for $29 so I wasn't expecting much. But I definitely wasn't prepared for what we found. When we arrived we had high hopes, the outside looks old, but the neighborhood is not as bad as we had feared. The lobby looks recently renovated, so our hope was restored. However, as soon as we got off the elevator on the 4th floor, the hallways smelled like mildew. When we got to our room we were really mortified at what poor condition it was in. The room smells like mildew and the bathroom reeks of urine. The whole room feels and looks dirty and grimy. I was afraid to take my shoes off in the room or to even sit on the furniture. The shower was moldy; the wallpaper was literally falling off the walls; there were cobwebs in the closet. The ceiling is severely water damaged and is cracking and looks like it is caving in. They apparently tried to patch the ceiling, but did a horrible job. We asked for a room change and were told they were sold out. We decided to grin and bear it as we had after all only paid $29 for the stay. THEN, to top everything off, there is some venue next door that had been rented out for a party. They played LOUD music until well after midnight. We called the front desk and were told that there was nothing they could do about it and that we couldn't even move to a room further from the noise because they were sold out. Nor could we move to the other Ramada down the road because they are all individually owned. If I had to do it all over again, I would spend the money to stay at a decent place. I guess I learned my lesson.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for my purposes”
Reviews.Author: LarryFleisher
Reviews.Content: It depends what you're looking for, but if you're someone like me who doesn't want to drive everywhere and has no problems with public transportation, the location can't be beat. It's right next to a Subway Stop and if you're going to an event at the Staples Center, it's a 20-minute trip. It's also convenient to buses going to Santa Monica, Hollywood and other parts of the city. I'd like more of a selection at the continental breakfast but that's a minor issue especially since a "Coffee Bean" is nearby. My room was a non-smoking room but I didn't smell any smoke traces and the front office staff was helpful, especially letting me store my bags with them while I did some errands waiting for the room to get ready.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant enough for our first night in LA”
Reviews.Author: LazyDays38
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite nice. The hotel staff were pleasant, the room itself was nice (although even when you request a 'non-smoking' room, it still seems to always have that smell like it used to be a smoking room and then they changed it to a non smoking). It is a little overpriced for what you get (just the room, no complimentary breakfast) and the location is ok - close to metro that can take you to universal/hollywood blvd as well as Ralphs and fast food restaurants. I probably wouldn't stay here again due to the price but I wouldn't say it was the worst place we'd ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the Reviews!”
Reviews.Author: jeffnrena
Reviews.Content: I got a deal on e-bay for this hotel, and after reading the reviews I was terrified of what I was going to find when I checked in. Here's what I found......VERY pleasant front desk staff, inexpensive parking ($5) in a garage with plenty of space, spacious room with 2 beds, a refrigerator and a VERY large bathroom, new carpet, clean comfortable beds, and a decent continental breakfast in the morning! I think other reviews may have mistaken "old" for "dirty." Keep in mind, Hollywood and the LA area are OLD and anything but luxurious. What we didn't find upon check-in was a beautiful new building, updated facility, or upscale neighborhood. The location is in an area that many could consider "scary" but truthfully it is just "different." It is in Korea-town so there are many businesses with Korean (Asian?) signs and patrons. The area is very run-down, but hey, that's LA for ya unless you're headed for Beverly Hills or the OC. I wouldn't recommend spending much time walking in the area, but my husband, I and our 2 kids slept VERY comfortably, showered, had a cup of coffee in the morning and enjoyed our weekend at Universal Studios (10 min. away) and Griffith Park (10 min. away). Unless you are VERY particular about EVERYTHING, you will be perfectly comfortable in this hotel for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “great room, great price!!!”
Reviews.Author: emil_abreu
Reviews.Content: I have read good and bad reviews abou this place, and I have to say I was nervous the I got there; because I didn't know what to expect. The truth is that this hotel was recently RENOVATED. The room was comfortable and VERY CLEAN. The hotel also has a nice free covered parking; and offers free continental breakfast. The hotel surroundings are fine, but there's not much to see. Anyway it's very well located, close to everything. And the best of all, you get all this for just $85 a nigth. Great hotel for this little money! I ABSOLUTELY RECOMMEND IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible..worst hotel I ever stayed in! Read all reviews before you book! BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: RamadaSux
Reviews.Content: Read all the reviews before you book your stay at this hotel. It is a bad place and the other people who left the reviews are telling the truth. The room was infested with ants and spiders. Who knows what was crawling under the carpet. The room was on the 4th floor with bugs which means the entire facility is infested. Who wants bugs crawling on them during the night in bed??? Yuck. Who wants to bring bugs home with them in their luggage? The customer service at the hotel isn't great and I called Ramada's customer serivce which is bad too. They said they would call me back within 7 days and never did. I finally called them and they offered me a $25 gift certificate. What an insult! Luckily, I was able to check out and get a refund shortly after my arrival. We had to walk 5 blocks to find another hotel that was decent. Nice vacation right? I was expecting all of this after a 5 1/2 hour flight from Jersey. DON"T STAY HERE! DON"T STAY AT ANY RAMADA. The company is not customer service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Dark Little Place”
Reviews.Author: WestValleyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Room was not very clean and that was after going down a dark hall to the room. This is not in a good part of town: eat before or bring your dinner to your room. Don't go walking about!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel ! Pleasantly suprised and want to go back !”
Reviews.Author: flylife
Reviews.Content: I only have nice things to say about the Ramada Wilshire. It was my second hotel I checked into in LA and definitely the nicest. *The girls on the front desk were very friendly and helpful (even suggesting I buy a phone card because room phones were expensive !) A later check-out time was even granted. *The breakfast was plentiful &always fresh. * The location was very convenient , with a train stop only 5 minutes away. * free internet in the lobby was great and very nice little bonus * The room was cosy , quiet & had loads of character ( loved the retro purple carpet !) * The general atmosphere was quiet and unobtrusive. Cool like LA! I thoroughly recommend this little place and would have no hestitation in staying here again !

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, bad location, horrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: ultramar23
Reviews.Content: Not only are the pictures deceiving but the location is horrible, the rooms are not clean and the customer service was completely subpar. The hotel is in a seedy part of town that is noisy and unsafe. In addition, it is definitely not a family-oriented hotel. The suites are completely awkward. The tv is positioned so that only those sitting on the couch can view it and the carpet was so dirty we had to change socks a few times. The lighting in the room is horrible, there isn't one central switch to turn on the lights even in just one section of the room. You have to turn on each light individually. The tub looked like it had not been cleaned in a long while as did the bathroom countertops. One of the features listed for this hotel is free wireless internet access. When we had trouble accessing the internet from our room we were told by the front desk that he had no idea how to assist us and that was the end of that. We had to basically figure it out for ourselves. Overall, I give this hotel no stars. I will never stay at this hotel again. Please see my review of the Ramada Limited - S. Westlake location. Do not stay at that hotel either as it is worse than this location.

Reviews.Title: “Straight up nasty.”
Reviews.Author: steeevoboy
Reviews.Content: My buddy booked this hotel without confronting me first and before I got there I read all these reviews and was expecting the worst. Sure enough, thats what we got. The moment we got there I was expecting a rude staff member and thats exactly what we got. The guy was wicked unfriendly and would not make eye contact with us. The guy is working customer service and when you choose to work such a job, you are supposed to be friendly, etc. Next we pulled into the parking garage which was not so bad and headed up to the room. We got in the room and smelled a strong smell of smoke which pretty much sucked because we booked a non smoking room. When we checked into the hotel, the guy said the place was booked solid so we didn't even bother with requesting another one. We scoped out the room and it had old stained furniture, the tv cabinet was warped and looked like crap. The sheet that in normally supposed to be fitted to the mattress was just a regular sheet so as soon as you sat down or got in it, the sheet would start coming up to show the nasty mattress. Speaking of the mattress, the thing had no support at all, one of the worst mattresses I have ever layed on. Onto the floor, it had stains all over the place and even a piece of gum was stuck to it. The painting were crooked, there were cracks in the walls. Ok, so now we checked out the bathroom. More cracks in the walls, the tub itself had dirt in it. It had not been cleaned and looked straight up gross. We had to put down a towel to walk on when we took a shower. The toilet seat was not attached to the toilet so it just fell off. This was by far the worst hotel I have ever stayed in and I would give it less then a 1 if I could. The neighborhood that the hotel is in is really not that bad. Within walking distance are tons of places to eat. We got some Korean BBQ that was really good and it was right next to the hotel. Also next to the hotel were several sushi places and other food joints. So I really have nothing bad to say about the area. It is centrally located between Santa Monica and Hollywood. Now there is a bar thats attached to the hotel or apart of the hotel, how ever you want to put it. It was a chill atmosphere but I got the feeling that the Asian girls working in it and sitting at the bar were prostitutes. They had couches that were blocked by fold up walls where I can see seedy stuff going down. That is just the vibe me and my buddy got but we could be wrong. It was nice and the staff was friendly though. The only type of person I would recommend to stay in this hotel is maybe some party kids who will be out all night and are just using the beds to crash and do not really care about anything else but even then, I would probably say steer shy of this place and look at different hotels up on this site. We booked the hotel from orbitz for 2 days and canceled the 2nd day as soon as we arrived. We got charged 25 bucks for canceling but it was worth staying somewhere else. We were paying a 100 bucks a night at this place and then I went looking on here for better hotels for the 2nd night and found The Omni for 160 and decided to go with it. The Omni was one of the nicest hotels I have stayed in and can't be beat for the price. It was wicked nice and the staff was awesome. I highly recommend staying there if you do not mind staying in downtown LA. To recap, just don't stay at this place, you will regret it. Oh, I took photos of the nasty room so take a look.

Reviews.Title: “Lost My Shirt”
Reviews.Author: ejboldt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had stayed at this hotel before and although the service wasn't great and the hotel is kind of dingy, the location is perfect for our needs in LA. This time, however, the housekeeper took my shirt! I came back from shopping and looked for my "relaxing" t-shirt and couldn't find it. Went to the front desk to see if maybe the shirt had been picked up with the sheets when the room was cleaned. They wouldn't look and told me I must have left it somewhere. My husband complained later and the front desk manager said we were lying to get a free night. We had never even said anything about a free night and hadn't expected one. I just wanted my shirt back!! Don't expect good service here.

Reviews.Title: “The staff is inconpetent, I had to get into a shouting match with owner.”
Reviews.Author: kitkay
Reviews.Content: The unfriendly staff does not know what they are doing. They charged my account twice and I had to get into a shouting match in order to have the problem fixed. I had booked the room through the internet at one of the hotel service sites and they obviously charged my account months before my arrival. At check out I noticed another charge and they would not reverse it until we had shouted enough. Actually they made the internet site give me a refund instead which is really crumy because the site does not get the business they were entitled to get since that's how I booked it initially. Parking is a real problem because the limited size garage. I would not recoment this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent”
Reviews.Author: Whirliebird
Reviews.Content: I booked a block of rooms for my wedding guests at this Ramada. When my guests would call and try to reserve a room, the hotel staff turned away my actual guests who were coming to the wedding by telling them that they had either not heard of the block of rooms reserved or they should book through the internet. When my guests tried to book through the internet, there were no rooms available. I was then charged for about 30 empty rooms. I find this unacceptable and fraudulent. Do not trust this hotel with your money. The guests who stayed there were not happy with the customer service either.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: Truckman-Mick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Christmas 2005. Location ok. Not far from Hollywood, and a 15 minute bus ride to Beverly Hills. The hotel itself was average, and the view from my window was of a building site opposite. The room was clean, but not exactly elaborate. The staff were ok, but not over friendly. The area was not too safe at night. So if out, and wanting to go back to the hotel, better to get a taxi. Plenty of take aways near hotel. The room contained the smallest coffee maker i've ever seen. It also made the coldest coffee i've ever had. Would I stay again? If I had to!!

Reviews.Title: “Ramada Inn Comes Through in the Clutch”
Reviews.Author: keyspan
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review to give an account of an experience that was recent, and not as scary as some of the others that I had read before heading over. My fiancee and I found this Ramada Inn available somewhat last minute after having previous hotel arrangements with friends fall through prior to a conference in late May 2006. We stayed for a total of 4 nights. We booked on-line (ramada's website), and felt the rate was decent, but almost cancelled later once we read the reviews on this site and a friend familiar with LA told us were were going to be in Koreatown. In the end, we didn't cancel, and overall I'm glad we stuck with the reservation. Here are some plusses and minuses of our experience there: Advantages/Expected: 1) Parking: We paid a total of $5 for the entire stay, the lot is half a block down from the main entrance and you can put your car in a gated, enclosed structure if you choose to do so. Of note, we made good use of our rental car while we were in LA. 2) We were upgraded for free since we were staying for 4 nights into a suite so perhaps the following amenities are not available in every room but we had the following: a) Two telephones b) Television, sofa, study desk, dresser c) Well kept, clean, well-lit bathroom with two sinks d) Small refrigerator e) Room was spacious, with a sliding door diviion between the bedroom area and the desk/sofa area While we didn't spend that much time in the hotel room, it was nice to have so much space and all the basic amenities in good order. 3) Climate control was easy to adjust and came in handy when it got humid 4) Free internet access on a computer in the lobby area - unfortunately, it was popular to use, and since there is only one... 5) Breakfast - We may have figured out why the reviews are so varied, the earlier one goes, the more that is available (they're not really great about re-stocking). It starts at 7:30 am - there are bagels (plain, sesame, etc.), simple breads, jellies, juice, water, whole milk, three cold cereals, coffee, and oranges available. They have toasters there for use as needed. It's not gourmet, but is a nice simple option overall. The pickings were definitely slimmer when we swung by around 10am one morning as compared to 7:30 when it starts. 6) Overall rate was within our limited travel budget, and we felt we got/did slightly better than what we paid fo. There were no funny/unexpected charges as was the case with some other hotels I saw reviews on. Disadvantages: 1) Floor was wet around the refrigerator when we initially entered the room on the first night - ? were they defrosting it, this wasn't an issue afterwards 2) Location - Not really quite a disadvantage since Wilshire Ave is a good East-West throughfare of LA so it was easy enough to find, get to places (e.g. Hollywood/ Airport/ Beaches on the West/ Convention Center) overall with a car. We weren't disturbed by traffic while in the room. A subway line is a few blocks away, though we didn't use it. Nonetheless, it is in the northern part of Koreatown, and probably wouldn't be a place you want to hang out by yourself at night. You're probably not going to go for a midnight stroll just to see what's around, or open the curtains in the morning and smile at the amazing view. 3) Front desk staff is not the most friendly in the world - they're certainly not mean, but I guess smiling doesn't exactly come easy either. We were a little scared going in when we called to let the hotel know that we were going to be getting in late, and unfortunately we could not communicate this since the two people at the front desk at the time (late night) could only speak Korean. By the time we got there though, the shift must have changed because everyone spoke English - and we never had a problem throughout our stay. +/- No goodies in the hotel rooms (e.g. small chocolate bars, etc.) to pick on. The television had basic cable - no frills. +/- Nightclub - there is a nightclub that had some loud dance music blasting when we got there. While we actually checked it out for a bit just for fun (there is a back entrance into the club area from the lobby) we decided to call it a night early. Luckily we were a few floors up and on the opposite end of the nightclub so the music wasn't a nuisance, but we could still hear it slightly. This might be something worth asking about if you make a reservation over the phone and are planning to stay over the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Dispointing Experince. Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After being a long time Ramada Inn customer, after my stay at this Ramada I can say that I will never stay at a Ramada again. Upon arrival I was told that my room that I had reserved online had been given to someone else.They upgraded my room to a suite, and that is where the customer service ended. I had requested a non-smoking room, and was placed on a non-smoking floor however the whole floor was saturated with the smell of fresh cigarette smoke. The room itself was less then desirable. There were no towels in the bathroom, and when I went down to the front desk the clerk working had no customer service skills what so ever! She questioned why I needed towels, and refused to give me more then 2 towels. I was appalled by the staff's rudeness, and the over all filth of the hotel. The elevator always seemed to have a questionable smell. I couldn't wait to check out of the hotel. I have never been treated so badly.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place! Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mack90210
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a week at the start of Feb. Grace, who worked on the front desk was very friendly and helpful. There was another gentleman who worked on the desk sometimes - he didnt take any nonsense from anyone but seemed like a fair guy. My only complaint was that the wireless internet connection didnt work in the bedroom - you have to go to the lobby to get a connection. The location is great - there are some great restaurants nearby if you like Asian food. I give this hotel two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “This is the worst hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a room charge demanded double by Ramada Inn Wilshire. Though an option except for the telephone wasn't used!! There was no answer from them for my protest either. I never do recommend this hotel to the others!!!

Reviews.Title: “you WILL regret it BIG time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review 3 months after my stay there. Sure the room was decent for the price. Not the Ritz, but it had the necessities. Nevermind that I put a ding in our rental car because the parking spaces were SO narrow, I tried to be optimistic given the price... until after my check-out... I had prebooked and prepaid through Expedia, however Ramada still charged my credit card. Each time I called the hotel about my refund (which they assured me I would get after they were paid by Expedia), it was the same, "just wait until your next credit card statement." After at least a total of 10 phone calls to both Expedia and Ramada (it was the principle now more than the actual money), Expedia kindly offered me a settlement. Point of my story: DON'T waste your time, long-distance minutes, and frustration on this backwards place. They should be ashamed of themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great, if you like Fire Alarms at 3AM.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While this is not such a bad place (a little too expensive) and located in a pretty good central location, we found that the FIRE ALARM blaring at 3AM was a bit too much to handle. False alarm, sure, but it happened TWICE again that same morning. The "continental breakfast" (donuts) the next morning was little consolation for our jilted nerves. The suite was spacious though and the amenities were at least what we were told they would be. Parking was only $5 for the two nights we were there. The nieghborhood felt safe though it was loud with sirens etc.A chuch Bell rang at the top of the hour and 30 minutes after from 9 AM till late night. But, getting to Silverlake, Sunset, Culver City took less than 20 minutes without getting on the freeway. The hotel lounge had a sultry lady singer whose voice filtered into the lobby as we waited for the elevator. Basic and pleasent, though next time we don't want the 3 AM fire drill!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value In Central LA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall this hotel was a good value. It is in Koreatown, only one block away on the same side of the street from the Wiltern Theatre. I was not charged for parking and found a great spot on the upper level of the garage next to the elevator. We were so close to buses and the Metro that we used them to get to the museum for the King Tut exhibit and Hollywood & Highland but please bring plenty of dollar bills for tickets since making change is a pain. The cozy lobby has a complimentary computer with Internet access but no printer. The quaint dining room is used for continental breakfast which was decent. I recommend the Junior Suite for small families since there is a pull-out sofa separated by a door to the bedroom. The Internet rate was under $90 a night for 2005. The only drawback here is the customer service at the front desk is less than stellar. Please make sure you take all of your belongings from the hotel and get your receipt when checking out (since they did not offer one) because you may not get any cooperation once you are out of there. This last comment is based on my experience with them.

Reviews.Title: “A suite of a deal and with continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: artdude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada on Wilshire because it was recommended by a trip advisor contributor. We needed a hotel close to the LA County Museum of ARt because it was showing the King Tut Exhibit. Fortunately, by the time we drove to LA from San Francisco it was already after 7 pm and the start time on our tickets was at 8 pm. So, it took only less than 20 minutes to drive down the street, find parking and line up for Tut. The room actually was a suite with a big living room area connected to a bedroom with louvered doors and a big bathroom with 2 doors from each room to match. The room was very clean and newly remodeled which my wife was very appreciative of. The neighborhood was in Koreatown and after the exhibit, we ate at a rice bowl restaurant that was open after 10pm Friday night. Parking was free which was great considering how at some hotels its another $15 charge. And, last but not least, they had an absolutely beautiful continental breakfast of bagels, cream cheese, choice of cold cerelals or oatmeal, fruits, juices, coffees and donuts. When I called Ramada's 800 reservations was able to get me a $88 rate for AAA members. The front desk was nice but I had problems when I called from Las Vegas searching for a lost credit card and the day shift f/d lady agent claimed that nothing was there sort of abruptly without asking my name, when I stayed, etc. A small negative compared to a wonderful stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Wilshire Center
